item.title: NMF: Nonnegative Matrix Factorizatioin
item.description: Decomposition To make it easier to understand, we start with a data point $\mathbf P$ in a $k$-dimensional space spanned by $k$ basis vectors $\mathbf V^k$. Naturally, we could write down the component decomposition of the point using the basis vectors $\mathbf V^k$, $$ \mathbf P = P_k \mathbf V^k. $$ This is immediately obvious to us since we have been dealing with rank 2 $(k, 1)$ basis vectors and we are talking about the $k$ coordinates for a point.
